info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McDowell, northeastern Rutherford and southwestern Burke Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 319 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Marion, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Thermal City, Glenwood, Fero, Dysartsville, Union Mills and Sugar Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
